intro: Acriopsis griffithii, commonly known as the Indian cowpea, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its edible seeds and leaves. Acriopsis griffithii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
